vectorData.altText: That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
Thatâ€™s right! A muscle fascicle, a group of skeletal muscle fibres, is surrounded by the perimysium.
This is a light micrograph of skeletal muscle in cross section demonstrating the epimysium, perimysium and endomysium.

Epimysium: the thick red-stained CT layer that surrounds multiple fascicles 

Perimysium (white arrows): the thinner CT layer which surrounds one fascicle 

Endomysium (white triangles): the innermost CT layer which surround individual muscle fibre
